âœ¨ transcriber | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a private, fast, and self-hosted solution for transcribing audio and video content from various sources, including YouTube.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Transcribe from YouTube URLs or local audio/video files â€¢ Two Whisper backends (openai-whisper, faster-whisper) with fallback â€¢ GPU acceleration (CUDA) with CPU fallback â€¢ FFmpeg detection
ðŸ“– Summary: Transcriber is an open-source, self-hosted web application that leverages AI (Whisper) to transcribe audio and video files or YouTube URLs. It prioritizes privacy and speed, offering GPU acceleration and a user-friendly interface with features like transcript history and temporary media cleanup.

âœ¨ ExploitDB-Hunter | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To efficiently find and download exploit code from Exploit-DB via a command-line interface, streamlining the workflow for information security professionals.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Search exploits by CVE ID â€¢ Search exploits by title â€¢ Download exploits directly from the command line â€¢ Interactive terminal interface for selecting exploits â€¢ Filter exploits by type, platform, port, and tag
ðŸ“– Summary: ExploitDB-Hunter is a lightweight Python command-line tool designed to simplify the process of searching and downloading exploits from Exploit-DB. It offers an interactive terminal interface, eliminating the need to manually browse the website and copy exploit code.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ ProximityLockSystem | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To automatically secure a computer by locking it when the user walks away with their paired Bluetooth device, preventing unauthorized access.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automatic system locking based on Bluetooth device proximity â€¢ Continuous monitoring of paired devices â€¢ Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, Linux) â€¢ Configurable polling interval
ðŸ“– Summary: ProximityLockSystem is a Python-based CLI tool that automatically locks your computer when your paired Bluetooth device moves out of range. It continuously monitors nearby devices, providing a privacy-first security solution for users who frequently step away from their workstations.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ storybook | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Developing, documenting, and testing UI components in isolation.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Develop UI components in isolation â€¢ Document components â€¢ Test components â€¢ Support for multiple frameworks (React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, Web Components, etc.) â€¢ Extensible with addons
ðŸ“– Summary: Storybook is a development environment for building UI components in isolation. It provides a workshop for developers to create, test, and document components independently of the main application, supporting a wide range of frameworks and offering numerous addons for enhanced functionality.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ tuios | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing multiple terminal sessions efficiently within a single terminal window, providing a desktop-like experience.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Terminal-based window manager â€¢ Vim-like modal interface â€¢ Comprehensive keyboard shortcuts â€¢ Workspace support â€¢ Mouse interaction
ðŸ“– Summary: TUIOS is a terminal-based window manager built with Go, offering a modern, efficient interface for managing multiple terminal sessions. It features a vim-like modal interface, comprehensive keyboard shortcuts, workspace support, and mouse interaction, leveraging the Charm stack (Bubble Tea v2 and Lipgloss v2).
